DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Display specific Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer with the specificed filters..
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
device# show bfd peer 192.168.2.1 interface Ethernet0 BFD Peers:
peer 192.168.2.1 vrf default interface Ethernet0 ID: 106764218 Remote ID: 3876686491 Status: up Uptime: 0 day(s), 0 hour(s), 51 min(s), 49 sec(s) Diagnostics: ok Remote diagnostics: ok Peer Type: configured Local timers: Detect-multiplier: 3 Receive interval: 300ms Transmission interval: 300ms Echo transmission interval: 0ms Remote timers: Detect-multiplier: 3 Receive interval: 300ms Transmission interval: 300ms Echo transmission interval: 50ms

device# show bfd peer 192.168.2.1 multihop local-address 192.168.2.2 BFD Peers:
peer 192.168.2.1 multihop local-address 192.168.2.2 vrf default ID: 2900535060 Remote ID: 0 Status: down Downtime: 0 day(s), 0 hour(s), 0 min(s), 30 sec(s) Diagnostics: ok Remote diagnostics: ok Peer Type: configured Local timers: Detect-multiplier: 3 Receive interval: 300ms Transmission interval: 300ms Echo transmission interval: 60ms Remote timers: Detect-multiplier: 3 Receive interval: 1000ms Transmission interval: 1000ms Echo transmission interval: 0ms

COMMAND.name: show bfd peer counters
COMMAND.help: Display specific BFD peer counters information

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Displays counters for the specified Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer with the input filters.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device# show bfd peer counters 192.168.2.1 interface Ethernet0 peer 192.168.2.1 vrf default interface Ethernet0 Control packet input: 25 packets Control packet output: 25 packets Echo packet input: 0 packets Echo packet output: 0 packets Session up events: 1 Session down events: 0 Zebra notifications: 0

device# show bfd peer counters 192.168.2.1 multihop local-address 192.168.2.2 peer 192.168.2.1 multihop local-address 192.168.2.2 vrf default Control packet input: 25 packets Control packet output: 25 packets Echo packet input: 0 packets Echo packet output: 0 packets Session up events: 1 Session down events: 0 Zebra notifications: 0

PARAM.name: vrf
PARAM.help: Display BFD peers associated with the VRF

PARAM.name: brief
PARAM.help: Display BFD peers information in tabular form

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Displays all Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peers or counters.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
device# show bfd peers BFD Peers:
peer 192.168.2.2 vrf default interface Ethernet0 ID: 1861362724 Remote ID: 3644437776 Status: up Uptime: 0 day(s), 0 hour(s), 0 min(s), 6 sec(s) Diagnostics: ok Remote diagnostics: ok Peer Type: configured Local timers: Detect-multiplier: 3 Receive interval: 300ms Transmission interval: 300ms Echo transmission interval: 0ms Remote timers: Detect-multiplier: 3 Receive interval: 300ms Transmission interval: 300ms Echo transmission interval: 50ms

EXAMPLE.summary: Display BFD peers in user vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
device# show bfd peers vrf Vrf7 BFD Peers:
peer 192.168.2.2 vrf Vrf7 interface Ethernet0 ID: 1861362724 Remote ID: 3644437776 Status: up Uptime: 0 day(s), 0 hour(s), 0 min(s), 6 sec(s) Diagnostics: ok Remote diagnostics: ok Peer Type: configured Local timers: Detect-multiplier: 3 Receive interval: 300ms Transmission interval: 300ms Echo transmission interval: 0ms Remote timers: Detect-multiplier: 3 Receive interval: 300ms Transmission interval: 300ms Echo transmission interval: 50ms

device# show bfd peers counters BFD Peers:
peer 192.168.2.2 vrf default interface Ethernet0 Control packet input: 239 packets Control packet output: 292 packets Echo packet input: 0 packets Echo packet output: 0 packets Session up events: 1 Session down events: 0 Zebra notifications: 0

EXAMPLE.summary: Display BFD peers counters in user vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
device# show bfd peers vrf Vrf7 counters BFD Peers:
peer 192.168.2.2 vrf Vrf7 interface Ethernet0 Control packet input: 239 packets Control packet output: 292 packets Echo packet input: 0 packets Echo packet output: 0 packets Session up events: 1 Session down events: 0 Zebra notifications: 0

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Displays all Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) profiles or the one specified.
Displays Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) configurations.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device# show running-configuration bfd ! bfd peer 192.168.2.1 interface Ethernet0 detect-multiplier 5 echo-interval 200 echo-mode receive-interval 200 transmit-interval 200 ! peer 192.168.2.1 multihop local-address 192.168.2.2 detect-multiplier 4 receive-interval 150 transmit-interval 150 !

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Clears counters of the specific Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer with the filters. BFD packet counters will be reset to 0.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device# clear bfd peer 192.168.2.1 interface Ethernet0 counters

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Displays Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) configurations.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device# configure terminal device(config)# bfd device(conf-bfd)# show configuration ! bfd profile fast receive-interval 150 transmit-interval 150 ! peer 192.168.2.1 interface Ethernet0 detect-multiplier 5 echo-interval 200 echo-mode receive-interval 200 transmit-interval 200 ! peer 192.168.2.1 multihop local-address 192.168.2.2 detect-multiplier 4 receive-interval 150 transmit-interval 150 !

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) profile.
DOCGEN.USAGE: BFD profile can be asscoiated with BFD peer, all the configuration in BFD profile are applied to the BFD peer. BFD profile can also be associated with protocol(BGP) config and the dynamic session created dervies all the config from the corresponding BFD profile.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# profile fast

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigure Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) profile.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# no profile fast

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure single-hop and multi-hop Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: For single-hop BFD peer interace must be configured and for multi-hop BFD peer local address must be configured. For link-local BFD Peer address, it is mandatory to configure link-local local address.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configure single-hop BFD peer with default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0

EXAMPLE.summary: Configure single-hop BFD peer with user vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 vrf Vrf1

EXAMPLE.summary: Configure multi-hop BFD peer with default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.2 multihop local-address 192.168.0.3

EXAMPLE.summary: Configure multi-hop BFD peer with user vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.2 multihop local-address 192.168.0.3 vrf Vrf1

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigure Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) single-hop and multi-hop peer.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigure single-hop BFD peer with default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# no peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigure single-hop BFD peer with user vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# no peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 vrf Vrf1

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigure multi-hop BFD peer with default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# no peer 192.168.0.2 multihop local-address 192.168.0.3

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigure multi-hop BFD peer with user vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# no peer 192.168.0.2 multihop local-address 192.168.0.3 vrf Vrf1

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure detection multiplier for Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer for timeout.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Default value is 3.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 device(conf-bfd-peer)# detect-multiplier 5

PARAM.name: echo_interval
PARAM.help: Configure peer echo interval value in milliseconds

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure desired echo packet transmit interval for Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Default value is 50 milliseconds.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 device(conf-bfd-peer)# echo-interval 200

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Enable echo-mode for Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command can be used to enable echo mode for BFD single-hop peer, echo mode is not supported for multi-hop peers.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 device(conf-bfd-peer)# echo-mode

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Disable echo-mode for Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command can be used to disable echo mode for BFD single-hop peer.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 device(conf-bfd-peer)# no echo-mode

PARAM.name: receive_interval
PARAM.help: Configure peer receive interval value in milliseconds

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure packet receive interval for Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command can be used to configure desired packet receive interval from BFD peer, default value is 300 milliseconds.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 device(conf-bfd-peer)# receive-interval 200

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Shut Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer administratively down.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command will change the BFD session state to DOWN.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 device(conf-bfd-peer)# shutdown

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unshut Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer administratively up.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command can be used to make BFD peer administratively up, by default BFD peer is administratively up.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 device(conf-bfd-peer)# no shutdown

PARAM.name: transmit_interval
PARAM.help: Configure peer transmit interval value in milliseconds

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure desired packet transmit interval for Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Default value is 300 milliseconds.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 device(conf-bfd-peer)# transmit-interval 200

COMMAND.name: passive-mode
COMMAND.help: Configure the BFD peer as passive

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer as passive, session creation will not be initiated by this peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: By default passive mode is disabled for BFD peer.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configure passive mode for BFD peer

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 device(conf-bfd-peer)# passive-mode

COMMAND.name: no passive-mode
COMMAND.help: Configure the BFD peer as passive

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigure Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer as passive, session creation will be initiated by this peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: By default passive mode is disabled for BFD peer.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigure passive mode for BFD peer

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 device(conf-bfd-peer)# no passive-mode

COMMAND.name: minimum-ttl
COMMAND.help: Configure minimum expected TTL for incoming multihop BFD packets

PARAM.name: ttl-val
PARAM.help: Configure TTL value in the range

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure minimum TTL value expected in incoming BFD control packet for an multihop peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Default value is 254.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 device(conf-bfd-peer)# minimum-ttl 250

COMMAND.name: no minimum-ttl
COMMAND.help: Configure minimum expected TTL for incoming multihop BFD packets

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure minimum TTL value expected in incoming BFD control packet for an multihop peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Default value is 254.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 device(conf-bfd-peer)# minimum-ttl 250

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure profile to be associated with the peer, all the configuration in the profile will be applied to the peer.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 device(conf-bfd-peer)# profile fast

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigure profile to be associated with the peer.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# peer 192.168.0.5 interface Ethernet0 device(conf-bfd-peer)# profile fast

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Displays Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) profile configurations.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device# configure terminal device(config)# bfd device(conf-bfd-profile)#profile test device(conf-bfd-profile)# show configuration ! profile test detect-multiplier 4 echo-interval 123 echo-mode receive-interval 123 shutdown transmit-interval 123 minimum-ttl 250 passive-mode

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure detection multiplier for Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer for timeout.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Default value is 3.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# profile fast device(conf-bfd-profile)# detect-multiplier 5

PARAM.name: echo_interval
PARAM.help: Configure peer echo interval value in milliseconds

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure desired echo packet transmit interval for Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Default value is 50 milliseconds.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# profile fast device(conf-bfd-profile)# echo-interval 200

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Enable echo-mode for Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command can be used to enable echo mode for BFD single-hop peer, echo mode is not supported for multi-hop peers.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# profile fast device(conf-bfd-profile)# echo-mode

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Disable echo-mode for Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command can be used to disable echo mode for BFD single-hop peer.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# profile fast device(conf-bfd-profile)# no echo-mode

PARAM.name: receive_interval
PARAM.help: Configure peer receive interval value in milliseconds

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure packet receive interval for Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command can be used to configure desired packet receive interval from BFD peer, default value is 300 milliseconds.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# profile fast device(conf-bfd-profile)# receive-interval 200

PARAM.name: transmit_interval
PARAM.help: Configure peer transmit interval value in milliseconds

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure desired packet transmit interval for Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Default value is 300 milliseconds.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# profile fast device(conf-bfd-profile)# transmit-interval 200

COMMAND.name: passive-mode
COMMAND.help: Configure the BFD peer as passive

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer as passive, session creation will not be initiated by this peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: By default passive mode is disabled for BFD peer.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configure passive mode for BFD peer

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# profile fast device(conf-bfd-profile)# passive-mode

COMMAND.name: no passive-mode
COMMAND.help: Configure the BFD peer as passive

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigure Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer as passive, session creation will be initiated by this peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: By default passive mode is disabled for BFD peer.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigure passive mode for BFD peer

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# profile fast device(conf-bfd-profile)# no passive-mode

COMMAND.name: minimum-ttl
COMMAND.help: Configure minimum expected TTL for incoming multihop BFD packets

PARAM.name: ttl-val
PARAM.help: Configure TTL value in the range

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure minimum TTL value expected in incoming BFD control packet for an multihop peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Default value is 254.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# profile fast device(conf-bfd-profile)# minimum-ttl 250

COMMAND.name: no minimum-ttl
COMMAND.help: Configure minimum expected TTL for incoming multihop BFD packets

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure minimum TTL value expected in incoming BFD control packet for an multihop peer.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Default value is 254.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# profile fast device(conf-bfd-profile)# no minimum-ttl

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Shut Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer administratively down.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command will change the BFD session state to DOWN.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# profile fast device(conf-bfd-profile)# shutdown

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unshut Bidirectional Forwarding detection(BFD) peer administratively up.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command can be used to make BFD peer administratively up, by default BFD peer is administratively up.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device()#configure terminal device(config)#bfd device(conf-bfd)# profile fast device(conf-bfd-peer)# no shutdown
